questions.promptMd: Which CTA MOST cleanly converts the narrative into action?

answers.contentMd: Approve the 4‑week pilot by Friday; 1‑pager linked; owner: Dana
answers.feedbackMd: Specific ask, deadline, artifact, and ownership.

answers.contentMd: Multiple asks: review, comment, schedule, and budget

questions.promptMd: True or False: A CTA aligned to the story’s stakes improves conversion versus a generic "next steps".

answers.feedbackMd: Correct. Alignment maintains motivation and relevance.
Generic asks underperform when stakes are clear.

questions.promptMd: Which friction removal MOST increases CTA follow‑through?

answers.contentMd: Pre‑filled approval link + calendar poll with 2 slots + summary attached
Ask to ‘reply all’ with any thoughts
Offer to schedule a brainstorm later

questions.promptMd: True or False: Ownership (who does what by when) belongs in the closing slide/section.

answers.feedbackMd: Correct. Owners and dates lock accountability.
